sen.j: 舞台は、奈良時代最末期の宝亀年間（770年 - 780年）、紀伊国那賀郡 (和歌山県)に住していた山人の大伴孔子古（くじこ）なる人物を主人公とする。
sen.e: The story is set during the very end of Nara period, Hoki period (770-780,) the central character of the story is OTOMO no Kujiko, a mountain man, who lived in Naga District, Ki Province (Wakayama prefecture).

sen.j: 孔子古は、ある時、山中に奇瑞の地を発見し、そこに精舎を建立し、仏像を安置したいと発願する。
sen.e: One time, Kujiko found an auspicious place in the mountains, and desired to build Shoja (a hall where priests practice asceticism, like a temple) to install a Buddhist stature in.

sen.e: Then, a wandering pilgrim appeared, and he offered to build a Buddhist statue referring to himself as busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues).

sen.e: The pilgrim entered into the hermitage in mountains, locked the door, and then the pilgrim told him to come back to see him after seven days.

sen.e: Satayu led the entire family and went to Kazeichi Village, then they saw a golden Senju Kannon ryuzo stood with the hatchet Sadayu offered in its hands posing of Semui-in (mudra for bestowing fearlessness) in a thatched hut.
